Rancangan APBD DKI 2020, DKI Anggarkan Rp 166 M Buat Septic Tank
04 Nov 2019, 22:26 by Taufiq Siddiq, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -Dinas Sumber Daya Air DKI Jakarta mengusulkan anggaran pembangunan septic tank komunal sebesar Rp 166 miliar dalam KUA PPAS 2020 atau plafon rancangan APBD DKI 2010.
"Yang septic tank komunal Rp 166 miliar tahun depan (di APBD DKI 2020)," ujar Kepala Dinas Sumber Daya Air Juaini di DPRD, Senin 4 November 2019.
Juaini menyebutkan anggaran tersebut direncanakan untuk 30 lokasi atau kecamatan di seluruh kawasan Jakarta. Selain komunal juga ada septic tank di rumah-rumah warga.
Juani menyebutkan untuk septic tank di rumah dinas dibuat seperti tank yang dibuat dalam tanah. Sedangkan yang komunal kata dia tergantung keadaan lahan, karena membutuhkan sekitar 10x15 meter.
Juaini menyebutkan pihaknya telah meminta data kepada wali kota setempat terkait kebutuhan septic tank yang totalna dimasukkan plafon rancangan APBD DKI 2020. "Satu kecamatan itu banyak tergantung kebutuhan di lapangan minya data dari Walikota," ujarnya.

DKI 2020 APBD Design, DKI Allocates IDR 166 Billion for Septic Tanks
04 Nov 2019, 22:26 by Taufiq Siddiq, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The DKI Jakarta Water Resources Office has proposed a budget for the construction of a communal septic tank of Rp 166 billion in KUA PPAS 2020 or the 2010 APBD ceiling design.
"The communal septic tank is Rp 166 billion next year (in the DKI 2020 APBD)," said the Head of the Juaini Water Resources Office at the DPRD, Monday 4 November 2019.
Juaini said the budget was planned for 30 locations or sub-districts throughout the Jakarta area. Besides communal there are also septic tanks in people's homes.
Juani said that septic tanks in official houses are made like tanks made in the ground. Whereas the communal one he said depends on the state of the land, because it requires around 10x15 meters.
Juaini said that his office had requested data from the local mayor related to the need for a septic tank which was totally included in the ceiling of the 2020 DKI Regional Budget. "One sub-district depends a lot on data fields from the Mayor," he said.
